intro_text: p_l and r_c head out to look for herbs, discussing the latest news.
decline_text: It seems like some mischievous cat has gotten into the herb storage and they have to sort it all over again.
success_text: They have a good discussion while foraging among the dunes and manage to come up with several ideas to discuss with c_n's leadership.

Carefully plucking some herbs, they discuss the latest signs from StarClan and ponder what to do about them. They manage to think up some tentative plans and return to camp to discuss them with the leader and deputy.
fail_text: They fail to interpret any signs, and are too irritated with each other to discuss any other news. Furthermore, neither cat manages to gather anything, the trip cut short by the ominous looking clouds springing up over the horizon.

intro_text: p_l and r_c take a look at {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} supply of herbs and decide to combine {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} efforts into searching for more. Two sets of trained eyes are better than one!
decline_text: Unfortunately they are interrupted by a cat claiming they have an emergency. Runny dirt is not an emergency. Ugh.
success_text: p_l and r_c decide to search in the slot canyons, where the deep clefts may yet harbour water and plantlife. It's a mark of both of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} skill and experience that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/return/returns} home with herbs for c_n, scavenged from the impossible heat.

p_l and r_c decide on a little friendly competition - one medicine cat to another, like all those silly bets the warrior make about hunting prey. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/reunite/reunites} when the sun is going down and walk into camp purring and playfully shoving each other with both {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mouths full of herbs.
fail_text: Both p_l and r_c are tense and it shows. Even though it should not be this hard to find any herbs {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/fail/fails} to find even a single one. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/return/returns} to camp frustrated and irritated with each other.

Even though there should be many herbs {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/fail/fails} to find anything. p_l blames r_c for distracting {PRONOUN/r_c/object} and {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/get/gets} into a huge argument.

As the medicine cats search deep within the slot canyons for the precious herbs that will keep c_n going, a light rainshower falls. Water, on any other day good news, instead spells doom. The rushing water sweeps through the canyon in a flash flood. r_c hears it coming, shoving r_c2 towards the canyon walls, but {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can't both fit on the little ledge, and r_c loses {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} grip on the rock, falling beneath the rushing water.
